update.description:
First PR to get all windows changes.

This is only covering all the changes needed for our cmake scripts in cmake/ directory. This is not even the minimal support, but should not affect builds on Mac or Linux.
update.title: Support for MSVC in cmake routines

content.raw:
I don't have a clear preference now, a part of thinking in the needs of:
 
 * Get boost libraries (the few of them) into the PATH when using dynamic
 * Binaries size will increase when using static 

 @iche033 if you found that using STATIC is more confortable, let's change that.  bec75c2
content.html:
I don't have a clear preference now, a part of thinking in the needs of:

  • Get boost libraries (the few of them) into the PATH when using dynamic
  • Binaries size will increase when using static

@iche033 if you found that using STATIC is more confortable, let's change that. bec75c2

content.raw: just curious here - when I compiled boost with default flags on windows it gave me static libs so I had to change this for it to link. Ogre's cmake also sets Boost to [use static libs by default if on win32](https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/edccf8cc52e3b23c5ce0a3c4d15d64c0c67ad6e0/CMake/Dependencies.cmake?at=v1-8#cl-118). Do you know which linking option is preferred?
content.html: just curious here - when I compiled boost with default flags on windows it gave me static libs so I had to change this for it to link. Ogre's cmake also sets Boost to use static libs by default if on win32. Do you know which linking option is preferred?
